relation: Each class will challenge you in some way. The key is to have good time management and ask questions if you do not understand anything.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {181706=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 35812=There is a lot of stuff to do on weekends. At the cafe the late night (a program on campus) always puts on events from 9 o'clock to 2 a.m. CAB another program does events a little earlier usually from 6 or 7 to as late as 10 or 11. There's usually a lot to do. My favorite thing is their destress week. They do a lot of destressing things the week before finals. Like massages, stress balls, music, dancing, crafts. You go for an hour or two to relax.}

textAfterTable: Western New England College makes you feel welcome from the first foot you step on the campus. By offering numerous First year programs in the first couple months, WNEC makes you almost feel like you've been there all along. There are always trips each weekend traveling to places like the Baseball Hall of Fame, the local Six Flags theme park, or nearby Boston, MA. There are numerous campus activities available to get involved in as well. By offering an Activity fair early in the year, Western New England College grants everyone an even opportunity to take advantage of any extracurricular activities that spark their interest. Am learning a lot The class size at this college is small, which allows you to get to know your professors much better. This can prove to be extremely beneficial if you need extra help in a certain subject. The professors are always at their office hours and eager to help students. Western New England College also offers help in the Writing Center and the Math Center to help maximize each individual student's learning potential. The Western New England College School of Business is accredited internationally by the AACSB (Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business), which offers exemplary education for any one interested in a business major; Accounting, in my case.
